net.kencochrane.raven.connection

Class AsyncConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kencochrane.raven.connection.AsyncConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Connection

    public class AsyncConnection
extends Object
implements Connection
    Asynchronous usage of a connection.

    Instead of synchronously sending each event to a connection, use a ThreadPool to establish the connection and submit the event.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsyncConnection(Connection actualConnection)
      Creates a connection which will rely on an executor to send events.
      AsyncConnection(Connection actualConnection, boolean propagateClose)
      Creates a connection which will rely on an executor to send events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncConnection

        public AsyncConnection(Connection actualConnection)
        Creates a connection which will rely on an executor to send events.

        Will propagate the close() operation.

        Parameters:
        actualConnection - connection used to send the events.

      • AsyncConnection

        public AsyncConnection(Connection actualConnection,
               boolean propagateClose)
        Creates a connection which will rely on an executor to send events.
        Parameters:
        actualConnection - connection used to send the events.
        propagateClose - whether or not the actualConnection should be closed when this connection closes.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(Event event)
        Sends an event to the sentry server.

        The event will be added to a queue and will be handled by a separate Thread later on.

        Specified by:
        send in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        event - captured event to add in Sentry.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        .

        Closing the AsyncConnection will attempt a graceful shutdown of the executorService with a timeout of SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT, allowing the current events to be submitted while new events will be rejected.
        If the shutdown times out, the executorService will be forced to shutdown.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setExecutorService

        public void setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService)
